title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: `button.DISPOSED` which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a `(` and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: While writing SWT code in build 204, when I type the following: `button.dispose`, the automatic code assist list pops up with two items: `DISPOSED` and `dispose()`.
EB: When I type `button.dispose()` and press enter, the code assist should recognize that I have typed a `(` and that it matches "dispose()" better than "DISPOSED". The automatic code assist should insert the correct method name without any confusion.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Start typing `button.dispose`.
3. Notice that the automatic code assist list pops up with the options `DISPOSED` and `dispose()`.
4. Type `(` immediately after `dispose`.
5. Observe that the automatic code assist inserts the selected item instead of recognizing the match between the typing and the available options.
